etymology.description: 受(受) (shòu, "receive"), 伤(傷) (shāng, "injury"), 了(了) (le, "particle indicating change")
etymology.interpretation: This phrase combines 受(受) (shòu, "receive") and 伤(傷) (shāng, "injury"), indicating someone has received an injury. The particle 了(了) (le, "indicating change") adds a sense of completion or change, signifying that an injury has occurred.

parts.english: particle indicating change; completed action; new situation

examples.chinese: 他在比赛中受伤了(他在比賽中受傷了)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài bǐsài zhōng shòu shāng le.
examples.english: He got injured in the competition.

examples.chinese: 他摔了个跤(他摔了個跤)，受伤了(受傷了)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuāi le gè jiāo, shòu shāng le.
